name: Arabesque
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

2. Step to one side and extend one leg out to the front of your body, keeping your working foot flexed (lifted).
Your back foot should rest comfortably behind you, with your knee straight.

3. Extend the opposite arm out in front of you at a 90-degree angle to your extended leg.
4. Stretch through the back leg and core, maintaining balance on one leg.

5. Hold this position for a brief moment and engage your muscle contraction.

6. Slowly return to the starting position by flexing both legs (bending your working foot) and lower your raised arm.

7. Repeat with alternate sides.
short_summary: Arabesque is an intermediate-level exercise for strengthening balance, leg strength and hip flexibility.
